import React from 'react'; import { Container, Row, Col } from "react-bootstrap"; import Santeros1 from "../images/Santeros1.png" var canario_passarinho = "https://www.recantocaipira.com.br/duplas/canario_passarinho/canario_passarinho.html"; var furia = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RJ8V-DpP1gM"; var condor = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Czu7Yc6Fnmo" const Texts = () => { return(

Los Santeros

Pedro Augusto de Souza Bergamo was born in Franca, a small city of shoemakers in the interior of São Paulo state, in Brazil. He was named after his maternal grandfather, who was a santero and raised by his mom and step-father who owned a guitar and a fan of 70's British rock. He is biological son of Pedro Bergamo and nephew of Antonio Bergamo from the accomplished Sertanejo duo "Canário e Passarinho" .

Coming from a poor upbringing, he started learning music by 6, through public municipal initiatives like EMIM. when he was 12, his mom joined a presbiterian church in which they would allow him to play acoustic guitar in the band. He played through 5 years in the worship group, where he developed most of his aural skills. When he was 18, after being expelled from the band for his temperament, he quit the church and moved with his father in São Paulo singing hard rock in festivals and motorcycle clubs. His father got him a job in a Sertanejo studio and after that a music store. In his twenties, after entering a drunk fight which almost cost his life, he quit music, returned to Franca and joined his step-dad leather business. He quit drugs and started his studies, which eventually earn him a master degree in chemistry. SOme years later his father would present him a "viola caipira", a Brazilian traditional instrument, but he didn't touch it until one barbecue that his cousin grabbed the instrument and played "O último condor" by Almir Sater. He started to compose music in Portuguese, influenced by singer-songwriters like Almir Sater and Zé Ramalho.

By coincidence a long time friend was putting a magician act and needed some original music. He wrote a theater script and original songs for the act "O circo de Aracnídea" but after the debut show, in which one actor throwed a bomb at the stage cutting all the sound system, the show was never performed again. In this period he also worked as a chemistry teacher and a radio host, besides playing in a Nirvana cover band and original rock bands like Blind a man and Furia das máquinas. When 27 years he moved to Finland to continue his scientific studies. He worked one year as a researcher in modelling and simulation in Pori Research Center of Outotec, then he worked with Digital Solutions at Outotec's Helsinki office. In Helsinki he met Joel Lindfors, which produced two of his songs: "Lago Brasil" and "Nos dois merecemos viver". After that, he moved to Sweden to take courses at Luleå University of Technology.

In the year 2020, he visited OctaSonus studios in Brazil, owned by Laio his childhood friend from Franca, and recorded three songs from the "Circo de Aracnídea" infamus show. The songs were "Abrahadabra", "Flores pelo céu" and "Feiticeiro Esteve Aqui". In the same year he returned to Finland and joined the Latin band "La orquesta del fin del mundo", where he met Rolando, Satu and Seppo. After a rearrangement of the band, he quit and formed "Pedro Bergamo & Los Santeros" with some of the integrants, which focus on Pedro's original music.

Line-up:

Pedro Bergamo - Acoustic Guitar & Vocals

Satu Lankinen - Accordion & Vocals

Rolando Camilo - Drums & Vocals

Seppo Salmi - Electric Guitar

 ); }; export default Texts;
